intro: Conostegia lundellii, commonly known as the yellow mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Conostegia lundellii typically grows in moist, open habitats like wetlands and woodlands. Its foliage is lance-shaped with a rough texture, and it has a fibrous root system adapted to wet soil conditions.
